Package voltage.core

Class VoltageModule

java.lang.Object
voltage.core.VoltageModule
public abstract class VoltageModule
extends java.lang.Object
The base class for your module.

    • Notify

      public boolean Notify​(VoltageComponent component, VoltageModule.ModuleNotifications notification, double doubleValue, long longValue, int x, int y, java.lang.Object object)
      The Notify() function is where you handle button clicks and other types of events.
      Parameters:
      component - the component this notification applies to.
      notification - the notification type.
      doubleValue - a double value that applies to some notifications.
      longValue - a long value that applies to some notifications.
      x - if used, the x coordinate of the notification.
      y - if used, the y coordinate of the notification.
      object - an object if it applies to the notification.
      Returns:
      true if handled.

    • GetTooltipText

      public java.lang.String GetTooltipText​(VoltageComponent component)
      Get the tooltip text for a component. Use this to display a non standard tooltip for a component.
      Parameters:
      component - the component to display a tooltip for.
      Returns:
      the tooltip text.

    • GetStateInformation

      public byte[] GetStateInformation()
      Gets the current state of the module. If you have special state info beyond the state of buttons and sliders, add it in the overriden function in your module.
      Returns:
      the state information

    • SetStateInformation

      public void SetStateInformation​(byte[] stateInfo)
      Loads the state of the module. If you have special state info beyond the state of buttons and sliders, add it in the overriden function in your module.
      Parameters:
      stateInfo - a buffer of state info.

    • GetStateInformationForVariations

      public byte[] GetStateInformationForVariations()
      Gets the current state of the module to be saved with a variation. By default, this saves the same data as is saved with a preset. However, you can choose to save less data, or no data, with a variation.
      Returns:
      the variation state information

    • SetStateInformationForVariations

      public void SetStateInformationForVariations​(byte[] stateInfo)
      Loads the state of the module saved with a variation. If you have special state info beyond the state of buttons and sliders, add it in the overriden function in your module.
      Parameters:
      stateInfo - a buffer of state info.

    • ProcessSample

      public void ProcessSample()
      Process one sample for your module. This is a high priority function and it needs to be as fast as possible. Avoid putting in any gui related functions. Only add code that is fast. Important: Use a timer to change user interface items. Your module will be very slow if you add the wrong code here.

    • ProcessBypassedSample

      public void ProcessBypassedSample()
      A module can be bypassed. Add your logic to handle a bypassed module. For example, what inputs will pass through to the outputs of your module if the user wants to see the effects of the particular module on the end result sound.

    • StartGuiUpdateTimer

      public void StartGuiUpdateTimer()
      Start the gui update timer with the default time of 50 ms.

      public int GetNumberOfPolyVoices()

      Parameters:
      component - the Voltage Component to receive the audio data?

      numSamples - the number of samples in the buffers.

      public void CreateUndoNode​(java.lang.String undoType, java.lang.String description, double previousValue, double newValue)
      Create an undo event for a double value.
      Parameters:
      undoType - used to identify the undo event in the OnUndoRedo() callback.
      description - a description of the undo event.
      previousValue - the before value.
      newValue - the after value.

    • ShowOpenFileDialog

      public java.lang.String ShowOpenFileDialog​(java.lang.String dialogBoxTitle, java.lang.String initialDirectory, java.lang.String fileTypesToShow)
      Show a modal open file dialog.
      Parameters:
      dialogBoxTitle - the title for the dialog such as "Load Sound"
      initialDirectory - the starting folder/directory.
      fileTypesToShow - A set of file patterns such as "*" or "*.jpg" or "*.jpg;*.png". If there is more than one, it should be seperated by semi-colons.
      Returns:
      if successful, the filepath to the the chosen file.
      See Also:
      OnUndoRedo(java.lang.String,double,java.lang.Object)

    • ShowSaveFileDialog

      public java.lang.String ShowSaveFileDialog​(java.lang.String dialogBoxTitle, java.lang.String initialDirectory, java.lang.String fileTypesToShow)
      Show a modal save file dialog.
      Parameters:
      dialogBoxTitle - the title for the dialog such as "Save Sound"
      initialDirectory - the starting folder/directory.
      fileTypesToShow - A set of file patterns such as "*" or "*.jpg" or "*.jpg;*.png". If there is more than one, it should be seperated by semi-colons.
      Returns:
      if successful, the filepath to the the chosen file name.

    • ShowDropDownMenu

      public int ShowDropDownMenu​(java.lang.String[] options, int currentlySelectedIndex, VoltageComponent showMenuUnderThisObject)
      Shows a drop down menu. We use special codes to populate the menu. A menu separator is indicated by {sep} A sub menu is indicated by double curly braces {{sub-menu-name}} In order to do a 'double' sub-menu or sub-sub-menu, you'd use {{sub-menu1}}{{sub-menu2}}Menu item This would look like sub-menu1 : sub-menu2 : Menu item New options: {ticked} and {disabled} Add {ticked} to add a tick mark to an item. Add {disabled} to disable an item.
      Parameters:
      options - a list of strings/separators to display.
      currentlySelectedIndex - the index of the string of the currently selected item. Use -1 if nothing is selected.
      showMenuUnderThisObject - the component that the menu will appear underneath.
      Returns:
      the index of the the selected parameter.

    • ShowMessageBox

      public void ShowMessageBox​(VoltageModule.MessageBoxType type, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String text)
      Show a message box alert.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of MessageBox
      title - the title of the message.
      text - the body of the message.

    • RegisterFileTypesForFileDrop

      public void RegisterFileTypesForFileDrop​(java.lang.String listOfFileTypes)
      Allow file drops
      Parameters:
      listOfFileTypes - a string of file types desired. Separate by semi-colons. For example, if you wanted to receive .mid files and .midi files, you'd use "mid;midi"

    • GetScreenScale

      public double GetScreenScale()
      Returns the main monitors screen scale.
      Returns:
      scale of monitor. Monitors at 72 dpi will return 1.0. High density monitors will return values greater than 1.0
